oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Paddy Carr
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Portrait of Creek interpreter Paddy Carr wearing a red striped tunic with beaded strap.

Paddy Carr was the son of an Irishman who had married a Creek woman. Born in Alabama, he early on showed proficiency in languages. He served as interpreter during the Creek delegation to Washington in 1826.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: McKenney, Thomas L. (Thomas Loraine), 1785-1859; Hall, James, 1793-1868
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Creek Indians; Indians of North America-- Biography; Indians of North America-- Portraits; Indians of North America-- History
Indigenous peoples
